text: can anyone help with an ideea why blog posts wouldn’t show the option for amp although the amp is turned on in blog settings?
Dumb question: the custom modules can be edited locally with the local server?
or they can be edited only through the design manager?

<@UFH0PPMEW> yes you can edit custom modules via FTP - you do not necessarily need the local server to do so. You also don’t need the design manager to do so either.

The design manager is still handy however as it will explain syntax errors that your local editor may not.
Are <font> tags no longer supported in designer manager for emails? they seem to be getting converted to spans? Anyone know?

I would not be surprised. I have seen the rich text fields get converted before.

In coded templates and modules however the font tags should be left alone
I’m getting this warning … anybody else getting it?
and only the path is specified, not the id … so why the warning?
looks like it’s a false alarm
can i make it go away?
also, while i have you … the ```no_wrapper=true``` still doesn’t work :slightly_smiling_face:

only way to make it go away would be to maybe switch to use module id instead, or include both. but the right way to make it go away means letting the appropriate HS person know - no idea whom that might be
can you link to your original post, I rememeber asking to see the full HubL for the area that had the problem and dont recall seeing it
i don’t know how to do that … i’ll reply there

Hello people, i have a problem with the indexation of my blog entries... Google is catching every article post on my blog and i was trying to find a way or an option to this from COS but doesn´t look that be that easy... Does anyone have any clue or solution about this??? I really appreciate if you can help me. Regards
<@UD5GXJW1M> what is it you are trying to do? Stop google from indexing the pagination?
